Extension module

Extension.exist_in_set(formula, set)[source]

Checks if there exists an element in the set that satisfies a given formula using Z3 solver.

Parameters:

  • formula – The condition or formula each element in the set is tested against.

  • set – The collection of elements to be tested against the formula.

Returns:

Returns True if at least one element in the set satisfies the given formula, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Extension.forall_in_set(formula, set)[source]

Checks if all elements in the set satisfy a given formula using Z3 solver.

Parameters:

  • formula – The condition or formula to test against each element in the set.

  • set – The collection of elements to be evaluated against the formula.

Returns:

Returns True if every element in the set satisfies the given formula, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Extension.generateFuntionsFormulas()[source]

Generates Python function definitions for formulas stored in a global formulas dictionary. Each formula is turned into a Python function that can be evaluated.

Returns:

A string containing Python code with generated function definitions for each formula.

Return type:

str

Extension.is_in_set(value, set)[source]

Checks if a given value is in a set using Z3 solver.

Parameters:

  • value – The value to be checked for presence in the set.

  • set – The set against which the value is checked.

Returns:

Returns True if the value is found in the set, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Extension.replace_assertion(assertion)[source]

Parses and replaces assertions within a given string with appropriate function calls for evaluation.

Parameters:

assertion (str) – The assertion string to be parsed and modified.

Returns:

A modified version of the assertion string where assertions have been replaced with function calls suitable for evaluation.

Return type:

str
